CONNECTION_NAME.description: Go to your Cloud SQL page, create a database and copy the 'Connection Name', it looks something like: myproject:mylocation:mydbname

DATABASE_TYPE.description: Either: mysql (default) or postgresql, note that if you change this, you will also need to change the driver

DATABASE_DRIVER.description: Either: com.mysql.cj.jdbc.Driver (default) or org.postgresql.Driver, note that if you change this, you will also need to change the type

JDBC_URL_OPTIONS.description: You can use this to append to the JDBC URL, the default URL is: 'jdbc:${DATABASE_TYPE}:///${DATABASE_NAME}?socketFactory=com.google.cloud.sql.mysql.SocketFactory&cloudSqlInstance=${CONNECTION_NAME}&unixSocketPath=/cloudsql/${CONNECTION_NAME}${JDBC_URL_OPTIONS}'
